com.example.ecom.controller

Class SellerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.ecom.controller.SellerController

  • public class SellerController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller responsible for handling seller-related operations, such as registration, login, product management, and logout.
    Since:
    2025-06-07

      • validEmail

        public boolean validEmail(java.lang.String mail)
        Validates an email address against format and allowed domains. Accepted domains: gmail.com, rediffmail.com, yahoomail.com
        Parameters:
        mail - email address string to validate
        Returns:
        true if the email is valid and domain is allowed; false otherwise

      • RegisterSeller

        public java.lang.String RegisterSeller(java.lang.String sname,
                                       java.lang.String smail,
                                       java.lang.String spass,
                                       MultipartFile pdfFile,
                                       java.lang.String sconfpass,
                                       ModelMap model)
        Handles seller registration by validating input, storing seller info, and saving the uploaded verification document. Validations include:
        • Password and confirm password match
        • Unique email check
        • Domain-restricted email validation
        If successful, the uploaded PDF document is renamed and stored. Failure cases will result in appropriate feedback messages being added to the model.
        Parameters:
        sname - seller name
        smail - seller email
        spass - password
        pdfFile - PDF document (ID verification)
        sconfpass - re-entered password
        model - Spring ModelMap for conveying messages
        Returns:
        the registration page view

      • slctslrhmprod

        public java.lang.String slctslrhmprod(int pid,
                                      HttpSession session)
        Selects a product to edit its quantity only.
        Parameters:
        pid - product ID
        session - HTTP session
        Returns:
        view for editing product quantity

      • editsellrproddet

        public java.lang.String editsellrproddet(int pid,
                                         HttpSession session)
        Selects a product to edit its details. Applicable only for the products that are pending for being approved.
        Parameters:
        pid - product ID
        session - HTTP session
        Returns:
        view for editing product details

        public java.lang.String EdtProductSelr(java.lang.String pname,

      • LoginSeller

        public java.lang.String LoginSeller(java.lang.String smail,
                                    java.lang.String spass,
                                    ModelMap model,
                                    HttpSession session,
                                    HttpServletRequest request)
        Authenticates and logs in the seller.
        Parameters:
        smail - seller email
        spass - seller password
        model - ModelMap to pass messages
        session - HTTP session
        request - servlet request
        Returns:
        seller home or login page

      • RegisterProduct

        public java.lang.String RegisterProduct(java.lang.String pname,
                                        java.lang.String pquant,
                                        java.lang.String pprice,
                                        java.lang.String ppd,
                                        MultipartFile image,
                                        ModelMap model,
                                        HttpSession session)
        Handles the addition of a new product by the logged-in seller. Validates numeric inputs, quantity constraints, and processes file uploads. If validation or file upload fails, appropriate error messages are added.
        Parameters:
        pname - product name
        pquant - quantity as string
        pprice - price as string
        ppd - product description
        image - image file
        model - Spring ModelMap for status messages
        session - HTTP session containing seller information
        Returns:
        product addition view

      • seller_permission_pending

                                                  HttpServletRequest request)
        Displays products awaiting permission for a seller.
        Parameters:
        session - HTTP session
        request - servlet request
        Returns:
        seller permission pending view
